intro: Gelpkea stipularis, commonly known as the stipular gelpkea, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have stipules at the base. Gelpkea stipularis is typically found in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade.
